entities.objectiveName: Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices
entities.contextSummary: Reporting and monitoring in security awareness tracks program effectiveness through metrics, user reporting of security concerns, and regular assessment of awareness levels. Initial reporting establishes baseline awareness and risky behaviors, while recurring monitoring tracks improvement over time. Awareness metrics include training completion rates, phishing simulation click and reporting rates, security incident rates, and time to report incidents. Effective monitoring demonstrates awareness program value through behavior change metrics, identifies topics needing additional training, shows improvement or degradation trends, and satisfies compliance requirements for documented awareness training. Monitoring should drive program improvement based on data not just measure for measurement's sake.

entities.name: Initial
entities.fullPath: Security Program Management and Oversight > Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices > Reporting and monitoring > Initial
entities.objectiveName: Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices
entities.contextSummary: Initial reporting establishes baseline security awareness levels and behaviors before implementing awareness programs, enabling measurement of program effectiveness through comparison of post-program metrics to baseline. Initial assessment methods include baseline phishing simulation measuring initial susceptibility, awareness surveys assessing security knowledge, review of security incidents indicating awareness gaps, and observation of security behaviors. Initial reporting identifies high-priority training needs, informs awareness program design targeting identified gaps, provides baseline for measuring improvement, and justifies awareness program investment by demonstrating current weaknesses. Without baseline, organizations cannot demonstrate whether awareness programs are actually improving security behaviors.

entities.name: Recurring
entities.fullPath: Security Program Management and Oversight > Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices > Reporting and monitoring > Recurring
entities.objectiveName: Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices
entities.contextSummary: Recurring awareness monitoring continuously tracks security awareness through ongoing phishing simulations, periodic training assessments, security incident trends, and user reporting rates measuring program effectiveness over time. Recurring monitoring includes monthly or quarterly phishing simulations tracking improvement, annual security knowledge assessments, metrics dashboards showing key awareness indicators, and analysis of security incidents identifying persistent awareness gaps. Recurring monitoring drives program improvement by identifying topics needing reinforcement, recognizing effective training methods, demonstrating return on awareness investment to management, and satisfying compliance requirements for ongoing awareness programs. Effective monitoring shows trends over time not just point-in-time measurements.

entities.name: Development
entities.fullPath: Security Program Management and Oversight > Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices > Development
entities.objectiveName: Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices
entities.contextSummary: Security awareness program development designs and creates training content, delivery methods, assessment mechanisms, and program structure based on identified needs, audience characteristics, and available resources. Development activities include identifying training objectives and target behaviors, creating or acquiring training content, selecting delivery methods (online modules, in-person training, videos, gamification), designing assessment methods, planning simulation exercises, and establishing metrics framework. Effective program development considers adult learning principles, uses varied engaging content avoiding dry policy recitation, tailors content to different roles and risk levels, leverages existing resources and frameworks rather than creating everything custom, and plans sustainable ongoing programs not one-time efforts.

entities.name: Execution
entities.fullPath: Security Program Management and Oversight > Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices > Execution
entities.objectiveName: Given a scenario, implement security awareness practices
entities.contextSummary: Security awareness program execution delivers training to users, conducts simulated attacks, measures effectiveness, and continuously improves based on results and feedback. Execution includes scheduling and delivering training ensuring all employees complete required awareness, conducting phishing simulations and providing feedback, collecting and analyzing metrics, communicating security topics through various channels (newsletters, posters, emails), and iterating program based on effectiveness data. Effective execution maintains momentum with ongoing activities not just annual training events, obtains executive sponsorship demonstrating organizational commitment, recognizes and rewards good security behavior, and creates security culture where awareness becomes ingrained in organizational behavior not just compliance exercise.
